instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pre maturely shuts off during boot
threads.message: Customers complaint shuts off before boot. I checked current sense resistors all good. checked and replaced clock chip good, main power rails are present no known shorts to ground no water damage the tantalum cap is the only thing I didn't change yet because it does not have a short to ground. Any other clues inshould look for?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pre maturely shuts off during boot
